words.source: Conjunction waw + definite article + noun; all major translations (KJV, ESV, NASB, NIV)
Root gabar (גבר) meaning 'to prevail, triumph, become mighty'; ESV, NASB, KJV, NIV all render as 'prevailed'
Adverb; KJV 'exceedingly', ESV 'so mightily', NASB 'more and more'
Repetition of position 3 for emphasis; NET notes 'the repetition emphasizes the depth of the waters'; Young's Literal 'very very mighty'
Preposition; all major translations render as 'upon' or 'on'
Definite article + noun; all major translations
Conjunction waw + verb root kasa (כסה) 'to cover'; all major translations render as 'were covered' or 'covered'
Definite article + noun harim (הרים); BibleRef notes this term is 'often translated as hills, or even high hills'; all major translations
Definite article + adjective from root gaboah (גבה) 'high, lofty'; all major translations render as 'high' or 'lofty'
Preposition; all major translations render as 'under'
Definite article + noun shamayim (שמים); all major translations render as 'heavens' or 'sky'
